藈字的基本解释

藈
kuí
〔藈姑〕即“王瓜”，一种攀援草本植物，块根、果实可入药。亦称“土瓜”。

藈字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuí］
［《廣韻》苦圭切，平齊，溪。］
见“藈姑”。

藈字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　藈； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1063第36
【集韻】涓畦切，音圭。【玉篇】草名。【爾雅·釋草】鉤，藈姑。【註】鉤，?也。一名王瓜。　又苦圭切，音暌。義同。

藈字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
藈字的起名意思

暂无。

Lotus
Basic explanation of words
Lotus
kuí
〔Logu〕 is the "king melon", a climbing herb whose roots and fruits can be used as medicine. Also known as "tugua".
Lotus
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [kuí]
["Guangyun" bitter and cut, level, stream. ]
See "Liao Gu".
Lotus
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Words] 　藈; Kangxi Strokes: 20; Page Number: Page 1063 Page 36
【Jiyun】Jianqi cut, Yingui. [Jade articles] Cursive name. [Erya Shicao] Hook, Liaogu. [Note] Hook, also. A king melon.　It's bitter again, and the sound is 暌. The same meaning.
